developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration option DATABASE_TO_LOWER is used to determine whether the database should convert identifiers to lower case. It is checked in multiple places in the code where identifiers are being used, and if the setting is enabled, the identifiers are converted to lower case using StringUtils.toLowerEnglish() method.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration option DATABASE_TO_LOWER is triggered whenever an identifier needs to be converted to lower case in the system. This can happen when retrieving user names, role names, schema names, etc. from the database.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the configuration option DATABASE_TO_LOWER on the system is minimal in terms of performance, as the conversion to lower case is a relatively lightweight operation. However, it can affect the readability and consistency of identifiers in the system if enabled.
